articles.title: Trump Halts Orsted Wind Project in Another Blow to Industry - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: The Trump administration has halted work on an offshore wind farm being constructed off the coast of Rhode Island by Denmark’s Orsted A/S.

articles.title: The Amazon Labor Day Sale for 2025 Is Now Live With Early Weekend Deals - IGN
articles.description: The savings have arrived early this year.

articles.title: Trump says furniture tariffs are coming later this year - CNBC
articles.description: Stocks for some furniture and home goods companies, including Wayfair, RH and Williams-Sonoma, tumbled after the market close, following Trump's post.

articles.title: Ethereum hits fresh all-time high amid wider market rally after Fed Chair Powell hints at rate cut - The Block
articles.description: The price of ETH, Ethereum's native token, set its previous all-time high of around $4,878 in November 2021.

articles.title: Dow Marks First Record of Year After Powell's Jackson Hole Speech - Barron's
articles.description: The Dow, S&P 500, and Nasdaq soared after of Fed Chair Jerome Powell's speech at Jackson Hole.

articles.title: Trump says Intel CEO agreed to give U.S. government 10% of company - The Washington Post
articles.description: The president put the value of the “deal” at around $10 billion,  saying he told the chipmaker’s chief executive that “it would be good having the United States as your partner” and “they’ve agreed to do it.”

articles.title: The EV tax credit ends soon — but there's a little bit of wiggle room for car buyers - NPR
articles.description: A federal EV tax credit worth up to $7,500 ends Sept. 30. But the IRS has just clarified that shoppers don't need to actually have the keys in hand by the deadline to get the credit.

articles.title: Google says it dropped the energy cost of AI queries by 33x in one year - Ars Technica
articles.description: The company claims that a text query now burns the equivalent of 9 seconds of TV.

articles.title: Popular restaurant chain files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy - MLive.com
articles.description: The chain says "insurmountable" pressures on the industry are a major cause for the bankruptcy filing.

articles.title: Stellantis (STLA) Reveals Its New Jeep Cherokee SUV amid Falling Sales - TipRanks
articles.description: After facing six straight years of falling sales, Jeep is trying to make a comeback by bringing back a brand-new version of its Cherokee SUV. On Thursday, automaker...

articles.title: Nvidia reportedly halts production on its H20 AI chips - TechCrunch
articles.description: Beijing is reportedly urging Chinese companies to turn to domestic chips just weeks after Nvidia got the green light to sell in China again.

articles.title: Cracker Barrel's New Logo Has Right-Wingers Posting About Sydney Sweeney, Finding Jesus - Rolling Stone
articles.description: There’s no indication that Cracker Barrel simplified its logo based on politics or wokeness, but Republicans are freaking out either way.

articles.title: Ether notches first new record since 2021 after Powell speech teasing rate cuts - CNBC
articles.description: The price of ether smashed through its 2021 record on Friday after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell hinted at upcoming rate cuts.

articles.title: BJ’s Wholesale Club’s Sales Slow as Shoppers’ Frustrations Grow - The Wall Street Journal
Visa Abandons Open Banking in US as Data-Access Debate Rages - Bloomberg
articles.description: Visa Inc. shut its open-banking business in the US amid regulatory uncertainty about consumer-data rights and the prospect of higher fees for customer information, according to people familiar with the matter.

articles.title: Waymo approved to start autonomous vehicle testing in New York City - TechCrunch
articles.description: It's the first permit of its kind, and a crucial step along the path toward launching a true robotaxi service in the Big Apple.

articles.title: Calif. teens are ditching office jobs, and making $100K before they turn 21 - SFGATE
articles.description: In order to secure a stable career insulated from AI job theft, many young people are turning to trade work.

articles.title: Germany updates: Economy shrinks more than expected - dw.com
articles.description: Europe's largest economy has shrunk, with industrial production and construction weaker than first thought. Meanwhile, Berlin is being urged to recognize a Palestinian state. Follow DW for the latest.
